DataElement.preferredName: Visceral Kaposi Sarcoma Lesion Confirmation Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether or not visceral Kaposi sarcoma lesions were confirmed.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Of, or relating to, or affecting the internal organs._A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin; however it may also occur internally. It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS)._A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part._Having been established or verified.

Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin; however it may also occur internally. It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS).:A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.

Concepts.definition: Of, or relating to, or affecting the internal organs.

A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin; however it may also occur internally. It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS).
A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.

Property.preferredDefinition: Confirmed; having been established or verified.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
